name: Lego TC Logo(1987)
description: A version of Logo for programming Lego TC in 1987.  This was one of Lego's first programmable robotic kits.

commands.description: Turns off all motors and lights connected to any outlet port
Clears the command center
Reports the number of times the state of a sensor changed from false to true since the last resetc command
Tells a light or motor to begin flashing - on for time1 tenths of a second...  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/lego-tc-logo-quick-reference-guide/page/n1/mode/2up
Sets which inlet port(s) will be used to receive messages about the sensors
Names the page that is showing
turns off lights or motors
Turns on lights or motors
Turns on lights or motors for time tenths of a second
Reverses the direction of the motor
Resets the counter(s) to zero
Resets the main timer to zero
Resets timer timernumber to zero
Reports the state of the sensor(s).  The state of a sensor is either true or false.
Sets the direction of motors to the even direction
Sets the direction of motors to the odd direction
Sets the amount of power sent to the outlet port(s), changing the speed of a motoro or the brightness of a light.  Level can be any integer 1 to 7.
Sets which port(s) will be used to send instructions
Reports the time on the main timer
Reports the time on timer timernumber
Tells Lego TC logo to pause for time tenths of a second
Tells Lego TC logo to pause until the specified condition evaluates to true
